description.narrative: This page compiles all relevant information from all the iterations (or phases) that have followed the implementation of the SSN pilot project in DRC that commenced in 2014-15. In general throughout the different phases/iterations the project targets female survivors of SGBV in Eastern DRC helping them improve their socio-economic status which in turns help themto reintegrate into their communities/families after being rejected by them due to social stigma. Beneficiaries are selected based on ICRC vulnerability criteria after having received health care and PSS in ICRC-run counselling houses or similar services of other organisations. Each beneficiary receives an unconditional cash grant split in 3 installments and is also given training in basic cashbook accounting business management confidentiality and hygiene for themselves and their children. SSN: hybrid between emergency cash and longer-term livelihoods programming Project evolution: 2014/5-2016 - Pilot project: 100 beneficiaries in South Kivu 2017-2018 - Phase II: 500 beneficiaries in South Kivu and North Kivu 2018-2019 - Phase III: 149 beneficiaries in South Kivu North Kivu and Kasai (including 20 PRP beneficiaries in South and North Kivu we funded the salary cost but not direct implementation costs associated to these beneficiaries) NB North Kivu only PRPs 2019 - Feb 2020 - Phase IV: 216 beneficiaries in South Kivu and Kasai 211 women and 5 minors (gender undisclosed)
